{{also|Drucken|drücken|Drücken}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*þrukjaną||to press}}, {{m|gem-pro|*þrūganą||to threaten}}, from {{etyl|ine-pro|de}} {{m|ine-pro|*trūk-}}, {{m|ine-pro|*trūg-||to press, beat}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|drukken||to press, print}}, {{cog|da|trykke||to press}}, {{cog|en|thrutch||to throng}} and, outside Germanic, with {{cog|sq|ndryqem||to stretch}}. Closely cognate with {{cog|de|drücken||to press, push}}: ''drucken'' is originally the southern form; the first German printers were in the south. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|[ˈdʁʊkŋ̩]|[ˈdʁʊkən]}} * {{audio|de|De-drucken.ogg|Audio}} * {{audio|de|De-at-drucken.ogg|Audio (Austria)}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-weak|druckt|druckte|gedruckt}} # to [[print]] ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-weak|druck|gedruckt|h}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|ausdrucken}} * {{l|de|bedrucken}} * {{l|de|nachdrucken}} * {{l|de|Druck}} * {{l|de|Drucker}} * {{l|de|Druckmaschine}} * {{l|de|Druckwalze}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Middle Dutch== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|dum|odt|*thrukken}}, from {{inh|dum|gem-pro|*þrukjaną}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|dum|/ˈdrʏkːən/}} ===Verb=== {{dum-verb}} # to [[press]] ====Inflection==== {{dum-conj-wk|druck}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|nl|drukken}} * {{desc|li|drókke}}, {{l|li|drökke}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:VMNW|ID10409}} * {{R:MNW|07874}} ---- ==Swedish== ===Adjective=== {{sv-adj|-}} # [[drunk]]; under the influence of alcohol ====Declension==== {{sv-adj-pastpart|2=drucket|3=druckne|4=druckna}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|sv|sömndrucken}} ===Verb=== {{head|sv|verb form}} # {{sv-verb-form-pastpart|dricka}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|sv|a=cdeknru|druckne}}
